Heboh Celana Cingkrang, Ini Peraturan Benar tentang Pakaian ASN
04 Nov 2019, 05:54 by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Penggunaan celana cingkrang sedang menjadi perbincangan di kalangan Aparatur Sipil Negara (ASN). Pasalnya, dari sisi agama hal tersebut tidak dilarang. Namun, Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi mengatakan bahwa ini tidak sesuai dengan aturan pakaian yang diterapkan oleh pemerintah.
“Masalah celana cingkrang itu tidak bisa dilarang dari aspek agama karena memang agama pun tidak melarang. Tapi dari aturan pegawai bisa,” ucap Fachrul di kantor Kementerian Koordinator Pembangunan Manusia dan Kebudayaan, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, jakarta, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Memang, berdasarkan Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) No 71 Tahun 2018, tata cara berpakaian para ASN telah diatur oleh pemerintah. Meski demikian, poin yang ditujukan lebih mengarah pada pakaian saat menghadiri acara resmi seperti acara kenegaraan, upacara bendera, dan lainnya.
Sedangkan untuk pakaian sehari-hari ASN, seluruhnya diatur oleh lembaga atau kementerian masing-masing. “Pakaian sipil harian atau seragam resmi sebagaimana dimaksud dalam pasal 3 ayat (2) ditetapkan oleh Kementerian/lembaga,” bunyi Pasal 4 ayat 5 Perpres No.71 Tahun 2018.
Bagi kementerian dalam negeri, Permendagri Nomor 6 Tahun 2016 menyebutkan bahwa Senin dan Selasa menggunakan PDH warna khaki, Rabu menggunakan PDH Kemeja Warna Putih, celana/rok hitam atau gelap, dan Kamis dan Jumat menggunakan PDH batik/tenun/pakaian khas daerah. Adapun celana pria yang digunakan setiap hari harus menutupi mata kaki. Sedangkan yang disebut celana cingkrang, biasanya ujung celana ada di atas mata kaki.

Splashy Cingkrang Pants, This is the Right Rule on ASN Clothing
Nov 04 2019, 05:54 by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The use of Cingkrang pants is a topic of discussion among the State Civil Apparatus (ASN). Because, in terms of religion it is not prohibited. However, Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi said that this was not in accordance with the clothing rules adopted by the government.
"The problem of short pants cannot be banned from the aspect of religion because religion does not even prohibit. But from the rules employees can, "said Fachrul in the office of the Coordinating Ministry for Human Development and Culture, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Jakarta, Thursday, 31 October 2019.
Indeed, based on Presidential Regulation (Perpres) No. 71 of 2018, the procedure for dressing the ASNs has been regulated by the government. However, the points addressed are more directed towards clothing when attending official events such as state events, flag ceremonies, and others.
As for the everyday clothes of ASN, all are regulated by their respective institutions or ministries. "Daily civilian clothes or official uniforms as referred to in article 3 paragraph (2) are determined by the Ministry / institution," reads Article 4 paragraph 5 of Presidential Regulation No. 71 of 2018.
For the Ministry of Home Affairs, Permendagri No. 6 of 2016 states that Monday and Tuesday use PDH khaki, Wednesday uses PDH White Shirts, black or dark pants / skirts, and Thursday and Friday use PDH batik / weaving / clothing typical of the region. The men's trousers that are used every day must cover the ankles. While the so-called cingkrang pants, usually the tip of the pants are above the ankles.
